reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Unending Chase Fulton Novels
reviews.reviewText: I have just discovered another Best Author! Thank You! You have kept me enthralled and entertained! Please keep writing! I am now one of your many fans!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Books continue to increase in tension
reviews.reviewText: These are good books. Not sure why they are Kindle Unlimited.In this book one of the main protagonist dies, Chase and Clark pull off an incredible intelligence coup. We meet one of the world’s best helicopter pilots and 9/11 happens.Ana may or may not be dead. Chase discovers that he loves another.People get shot, beaten up and blown up. Can’t wait to see where we go from here. Not just a good book. Is great book as Anna would say. I wonder where in the hell she is.YOU SHOULD READ THIS BOOK. YOU SHOULD READ THIS SERIES.Now for book 5.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I’ve read all 4 books so far & all I can say is WHAT A RIDE‼️. But this one just tore my heart out. 😢😩😪. So onto book 5 with a heavy heart.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cap Daniels does it again
reviews.reviewText: The suspense and intrigue of his drama propels the reader through the book. Excellent story development with surprise ending that leave s you needing more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I'm so glad I didn't find this author and this series of books until now. Because I can read 1 after the other and not have to wait for the next book to come out. I'm really loving the main character in these books. I like all the cloak and dagger Stuff.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Adventurous, daring, and full of espionage intrigue, kept me engaged, excited, and enthralled.
reviews.reviewText: Book Review - When the Chinese Ministry of State Security unleashes a bold plan to sink a massive U.S. freighter in the Panama Canal as part of an elaborate intelligence-gathering operation, American covert operative, Chase Fulton, is called upon to infiltrate the operation and turn the tides against the Chinese conspirators. “The Unending Chase,” Book 4 of the Chase Fulton series turned out to be another thrilling Cap Daniels action thriller read. It was an action adventure story with plenty of twists and turns with sufficient political and military intertwining. This Cap Daniels series is adventurous, daring, and full of espionage intrigue that keeps the reader engaged, excited, and enthralled. Each story in the series keeps me wanting more and Daniels keeps the excitement meter running with plenty of books in the series (15 to date) If there was such a thing as an “excitement meter,” author Cap Daniels would probably own the patent to it because it’s amazing how he incorporates so much thrill and excitement in all the novels that I have read so far. Another thrilling read by a talented and clever author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hold On To Your Tighty Whities! Cap Daniels Has Done It Again!
reviews.reviewText: In “Unending Chase”, Chase is taking us along on another breath-holding adventure …. literally. Danger follows at every turn as he, Clark and their team try to avert disaster in the Panama Canal. Both above and below the surface of murky waters bad things are afoot and heroic efforts are being made to thwart the diabolical plan. Meanwhile, just being in the vicinity of where his family was brutally murdered, shakes Chase to his core. Yet, he has a job to do … and it almost is his last.There are a few new faces added to this one that I feel we will see again in the future and some surprises, both good and bad along the way. We see a different side of Chase, maybe more than one that even surprise him. As always, Cap leaves us with a huge tease at the end wanting assurances that he is busy on the NEXT adventure.My husband is now an avid fan of Cap Daniels. too. I am an advance reader, but I make him wait for the launch … how diabolically mean is that??? You cannot go wrong with this exciting series, be you male or female. It appeals to both!If you are a sailing enthusiast or even if you are not, you might also want to pick up Cap's "I Am Gypsy". It is a bittersweet story as told from the perspective of a sailboat. All proceeds from the sale of this unrelated delightful book go to Hurricane Michael Relief efforts in Florida's Panhandle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I don’t know if Amazon is going to let me do this. I want to use one review for seven books. In the past two weeks, I have read seven books in the CHASE FULTON NOVELS series by Cap Daniels. The series is so tightly knit together that even when I have other books waiting on my Kindle, I have to read the “next” book in the series to keep up with the action. They are addictive. For those of you totally unfamiliar with the series, Chase is a young “troubleshooter” who works as a contractor for shadowy governmental agencies. Mostly he has been operating in the Caribbean, but he’s gone from the heat of the Panama Canal to an operation in wintery Russia that made me cold just reading about it. At present he is living on a 50’ catamaran which he homeports in St. Augustine, Florida.I’d like to tell you more, but I really don’t want to be a spoiler. I will say this: if you are a fan of the Caribbean thriller genre, you will love these books. If you are not … then what the heck is wrong with you? Too snooty?Buy these books. Read them in order. Sign up for Cap’s newsletter to get the painfully short freebie backstory book. Do it. NOW!David Thatcher Wilson, authorSmith Beach Press
I don't know why I like these books but I just do. I think the supporting cast are who intrigue me the most. Good reads all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 23, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Gripping stuff, the American James Bond easily as good as Fleming, Brown, Cussler and others. More please!
Starting to like Chase a bit better now. He still has his annoying habits but with some smart and talented people around him he's easier to take. Well written.
